message_1: What is the Vigenere ciphered text obtained when the plain text "MATHEMATICS" is encrypted using the keyword "CODE"? In the Vigenere table, the column for the first letter of the keyword is "C" and the row for the first letter "M" gives the ciphered letter "P". Using this method, the Vigenere ciphered text for the plain text "MATHEMATICS" with a keyword "CODE" can be found.
message_2:
To encrypt the plain text "MATHEMATICS" using the Vigenere cipher with the keyword "CODE", we first need to repeat the keyword to match the length of the plain text. In this case, the repeated keyword is "CODECODECO".

Now, we can use the Vigenere table to find the ciphered text by matching the row of the plain text letter with the column of the keyword letter. Following this method, we get:

M (row) + C (column) = P
A (row) + O (column) = O
T (row) + D (column) = F
H (row) + E (column) = L
E (row) + C (column) = G
M (row) + O (column) = W
A (row) + D (column) = D
T (row) + E (column) = W
I (row) + C (column) = R
C (row) + O (column) = S
S (row) + D (column) = V

So, the Vigenere ciphered text for the plain text "MATHEMATICS" with the keyword "CODE" is "POFLGWDWRVS".
